info.title: More Cars - REST API Specification
info.description: OpenAPI specification for the More Cars API

tags.name: Brands
tags.description: Car `Brand`s enables us to distinguish between car models from different car manufacturers. (E.g. BMW, Toyota, Ford.)

tags.name: Car Models
tags.description: A `Car Model` represents a group of cars with the same name, from the same brand and the same generation. (E.g. Ferrari Testarossa, VW Golf VII, Ford Fiesta Mk2.)

tags.name: Images
tags.description: An `Image` can be photo, an illustration, a logo, a screenshot or similar. It illustrates a car or a car-related object. Depending on the context that can be a brand logos, a race track layout, a book cover, etc.

tags.name: Companies
tags.description: A `Company` is the legal entity behind a Brand (e.g. the company BMW AG owns the brand BMW). A company can have multiple brands (e.g. BMW AG additionally owns the brands Rolls-Royce and MINI).

404.description: `Image` or partner node not found.
`Image` node not found.

404.description: No `Company` with the provided ID found.
No `Company` with the provided ID found.

id.description: A unique identifier which is generated by the system. Cannot be changed.

name.description: The name of the brand (e.g. 'Ferrari'). Not to be confused with the company name (e.g. 'Ferrari S.p.A.'). The official spelling is used (e.g. 'MINI' instead of 'Mini').

full_name.description: The long form of the brand's name, should it be abbreviated (e.g. 'VW' -> 'Volkswagen').

founded.description: The year in which the brand was established as a CAR brand. Not necessarily the year the company was founded. 'Peugeot' was founded in 1810, but they are building cars only since 1891.

defunct.description: The last year the brand name was officially used for a car model.

wmi.description: The WMI (World Manufacturer Identifier) is a unique identifier for a car brand resp. car company. In general it is a three character code as specified in 'ISO 3780'. Some manufacturers have multiple WMIs, some have none at all. Multiple WMIs are separated by comma.

hsn.description: HSN (Herstellerschlüsselnummer) is the German counterpart of the 'WMI'. It is a four-digit code that identifies the car manufacturer globally. Some manufacturers have multiple HSNs, some have none at all. Multiple HSNs are separated by comma.

created_at.description: Timestamp for when this node was created. Generated by the system. Cannot be changed.

updated_at.description: Timestamp for when this node was last modified. Generated by the system.

created_at.description: Timestamp for when this node was created. Generated by the system. Cannot be changed.

updated_at.description: Timestamp for when this node was last modified. Generated by the system.

created_at.description: Timestamp for when this node was created. Generated by the system. Cannot be changed.

updated_at.description: Timestamp for when this node was last modified. Generated by the system.

id.description: A unique identifier which is generated by the system. Cannot be changed.

name.description: The official name of the car model. Does not include the brand name, the internal code or generational information. E.g. instead of 'BMW M3 (E36)' it is just 'M3'

built_from.description: The first year of production. (Might differ from the 'model year'.)

built_to.description: The last year of production. (Might differ from the 'model year'.)

generation.description: When there exist multiple generations of a car model this number specifies which of those iterations is represented here. E.g. '7' for the 7th-generation of the 'VW Golf'. Multiple iterations can belong to the same generation (e.g. in case of facelifts).

internal_code.description: Uniquely identifies the generation (or facelift or variant) of a car model E.g. '997.2' is Porsche's code for the facelift model of the 6th generation of the '911'.

total_production.description: The number of cars that have been built in this generation. Includes all variants and special editions.

created_at.description: Timestamp for when this node was created. Generated by the system. Cannot be changed.

updated_at.description: Timestamp for when this node was last modified. Generated by the system.

created_at.description: Timestamp for when this node was created. Generated by the system. Cannot be changed.

updated_at.description: Timestamp for when this node was last modified. Generated by the system.

created_at.description: Timestamp for when this node was created. Generated by the system. Cannot be changed.

updated_at.description: Timestamp for when this node was last modified. Generated by the system.

created_at.description: Timestamp for when this node was created. Generated by the system. Cannot be changed.

updated_at.description: Timestamp for when this node was last modified. Generated by the system.

id.description: A unique identifier which is generated by the system. Cannot be changed.

image_provider.description: The platform that is hosting the image. Supported options are: 'flickr' and 'wikimedia'.

external_id.description: The official identifier of the image. Flickr uses numbers (e.g. '43644091312'). Wikimedia uses a URL-friendly version of the image name (e.g. 'File:BMW_Z4_Concept.jpg').

description.description: A short description of the photo or image.

creator.description: The creator, photographer or rights holder of the image.

license.description: The license under which the image was released. More Cars accepts images when they have a 'Creative Commons' license that allows commercial usage: CC0, CC BY, CC BY-SA, CC BY-ND.

tags.description: A comma-separated list of keywords which describe the picture.

source.description: The 'official address' of this photo, where licensing and additional information can be found.

image_url_original.description: The URL of the image in its original size.

image_url_xxl.description: The URL of the image in XXL size. Optional.

image_url_xl.description: The URL of the image in XL size. Optional.

image_url_l.description: The URL of the image in L size. Optional.

image_url_m.description: The URL of the image in M size. Optional.

image_url_s.description: The URL of the image in S size. Optional.

image_url_xs.description: The URL of the image in XS size. Optional.

created_at.description: Timestamp for when this node was created. Generated by the system. Cannot be changed.

updated_at.description: Timestamp for when this node was last modified. Generated by the system.

created_at.description: Timestamp for when this node was created. Generated by the system. Cannot be changed.

updated_at.description: Timestamp for when this node was last modified. Generated by the system.

id.description: A unique identifier which is generated by the system. Cannot be changed.

name.description: The official name of the car company, incl. the legal entity type (AG, SE, GmbH, N.V., s.p.a., Ltd).

founded.description: The year the company was founded.

defunct.description: The year the company was shut down.

headquarters_location.description: The city, town or region in which the company has its (de facto) headquarters.

legal_headquarters_location.description: The city, town or region where the company has its official headquarters. As an example, `Ferrari` is an Italian company, based in `Maranello`, but on paper they are a Dutch company, located in `Amsterdam`.

created_at.description: Timestamp for when this node was created. Generated by the system. Cannot be changed.

updated_at.description: Timestamp for when this node was last modified. Generated by the system.
